alert.note: Alert for Sabine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 5:34AM CST until January 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas, Louisiana and east Texas, including the following counties and parishes, in Arkansas, Columbia and Union. In Louisiana, Bienville, Claiborne, Jackson, Lincoln, Natchitoches, Ouachita, Red River, Sabine, Union, Webster and Winn. In east Texas, Sabine. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous showers and thunderstorms containing locally heavy rainfall will continue to shift east across South Central Arkansas, much of North Louisiana, and the Lower Toledo Bend Country of Deep East Texas through mid morning. Additional rainfall amounts of around an inch is expected, with isolated higher amounts up to 2 inches possible. Given the already saturated grounds, additional flooding will be possible across portions of the Watch area before the heavy rain exits the region to the east around mid morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
